alert.note: Alert for Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 12:47PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Fremont, Teller and northwestern El Paso Counties through 130 PM MDT... At 1246 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms developing along a line extending from near Westcreek to near Cripple Creek. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Woodland Park, Cripple Creek, Green Mountain Falls, Victor, Divide, Pikes Peak, Crystola, Chipita Park, Florissant and Cascade. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
